description: South Africa's government is calling for public comments on an updated version of its existing biodiversity economy plan.
title: South Africa's conservation model: Why expanding the use of biodiversity to generate money is a good idea

description: Scientists have analyzed the first batch of data from the Dark Energy Spectroscopic Instrument's quest to map the universe and unravel the mysteries of dark energy.
title: DESI first-year data delivers unprecedented measurements of expanding universe

description: Paleontologists have presented a new insight into the initial dental variations across mammaliaforms, providing a fresh perspective on the evolutionary past of these ancient beasts.
title: Jurassic shuotheriids reveal earliest dental diversification of mammaliaforms

description: While I was assembling and formatting all these links, we had a 4.8-magnitude earthquake here on the East Coast, so apologies in advance for any misaligned text. This week: Gravitationally accelerated stars! AIs that exhibit cooperative and selfish behaviors! And another edition of "Would You Eat This?"
title: Saturday Citations: AI and the prisoner's dilemma; stellar cannibalism; evidence that EVs reduce atmospheric CO₂

description: A Russian space capsule with two women and one man safely landed in a steppe in Kazakhstan on Saturday after their missions aboard the International Space Station.
title: A Soyuz capsule carrying 3 crew from the International Space Station lands safely in Kazakhstan

description: Tens of thousands of endangered salmon being transported by truck to a US river miraculously survived a road crash by escaping into a nearby creek, officials said.
title: Thousands of salmon escape truck crash into nearby river

description: East Coast residents were jolted Friday by a 4.8-magnitude earthquake centered near Lebanon, New Jersey, with weak rumblings felt as far away as Baltimore and the Massachusetts-New Hampshire border. No life-threatening injuries or major damage have been reported.
title: East Coast earthquakes aren't common, but they are felt by millions. Here's what to know

description: Sometime between now and September, a massive explosion 3,000 light years from Earth will flare up in the night sky, giving amateur astronomers a once-in-a-lifetime chance to witness this space oddity.
title: Huge star explosion to appear in sky in once-in-a-lifetime event

description: Some who hope to witness Monday's total solar eclipse may see the sun obscured by clouds instead of by the moon.
title: Eclipse weather forecast points to clear skies in the Northeast and central US. Texas is iffy

description: Optical sensors serve as the backbone of numerous scientific and technological endeavors, from detecting gravitational waves to imaging biological tissues for medical diagnostics. These sensors use light to detect changes in the properties of the environment they're monitoring, including chemical biomarkers and physical properties like temperature. A persistent challenge in optical sensing has been enhancing sensitivity to detect faint signals amid noise.
title: Innovative sensing platform unlocks ultrahigh sensitivity in conventional sensors

description: The Common Loon, an icon of the northern wilderness, is under threat from climate change due to reduced water clarity, according to a new study authored by Chapman University professor, Walter Piper. The study, published April 1 in Ecology, followed up an earlier paper that showed a substantial reproductive decline in the author's study area in northern Wisconsin.
title: Common loons threatened by declining water clarity

description: Rice University physicists have discovered a phase-changing quantum material—and a method for finding more like it—that could potentially be used to create flash-like memory capable of storing quantum bits of information, or qubits, even when a quantum computer is powered down.
title: Nonvolatile quantum memory: Discovery points path to flash-like memory for storing qubits

description: Europa is one of the largest of more than 90 moons in orbit around the planet Jupiter. It is also one of the best places to look for alien life.
title: If life exists on Jupiter's moon Europa, scientists might soon be able to detect it

description: The same class of artificial intelligence that made headlines coding software and passing the bar exam has learned to read a different kind of text—the genetic code.
title: Can language models read the genome? This one decoded mRNA to make better vaccines

description: The active ingredient in many drugs is what's known as a small molecule: bigger than water, much smaller than an antibody and mainly made of carbon. It's tough, however, to make these molecules if they require a quaternary carbon—a carbon atom bonded to four other carbon atoms. But now, Scripps Research scientists have uncovered a potential cost-effective way to produce these tricky motifs.
title: A simple, inexpensive way to make carbon atoms bind together

description: When you throw dinosaurs into the mix, sometimes you find that a rule simply isn't.
title: Dinosaur study challenges Bergmann's rule
